intro: Struthanthus polystachyus, commonly known as the desert goldcup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its structure consists of a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, scale-like leaves. The flowers are clustered in dense, racemose inflorescences, making it a distinctive and visually appealing species in its native habitat.
